snippet: The Directors Guild nominations do little to clear up this season's Oscar races; this year could be remembered as the one in which contenders just tried to avoid embarrassment.
abstract: The Directors Guild nominations do little to clear up this season's Oscar races; this year could be remembered as the one in which contenders just tried to avoid embarrassment.
lead_paragraph: With directors unveiling their feature film nominations on Monday, all the major guilds have offered their choices for pre-Oscar prizes. By this time last year, "The King's Speech" had more or less sewn up best picture, but the view this season is a lot cloudier, with more than a dozen films trying to get a foothold, our colleague Michael Cieply writes. He adds that this year's race "could be remembered less for its winners than for a large array of high-profile contenders who will be struggling - right up until the Oscar nominations are announced later this month - to avoid embarrassment."
